intro: Trichotosia pilosissima, commonly known as the hairy trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, hairy foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
